text: "Buried Myself Alive" is the second single from the Used's self-titled debut album The Used. The single was released on January 28, 2003 and a music video was released around the same time. ==Music video== The music video directed by Arni and Kinski features the band playing in an enclosed space. Each band member is in an inescapable situation: Bert is buried alive in a coffin; Quinn is tied upside down in a bedroom; Branden is trapped in a hall of mirrors; and Jeph is stuck and drowning in an underground sewer. ==Track listing== US promotional single # "Buried Myself Alive" (Radio Edit) – 3:36 == Personnel == * John Feldmann – engineer, mixed by, producer ==Charts== {| class="wikitable" !align="center"|Chart (2003) !align="center"|Peak position |- |align="left"|US Modern Rock Tracks[ Billboard.com - Artist Chart History - The Used] |align="center"|13 |} ==Release history== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- !scope="col"| Region !scope="col"| Date !scope="col"| Format !scope="col"| Label |- ! scope="row"| United States | January 28, 2003 | Modern rock radio | Reprise |- |} ==Notes== ==External links== * Category:The Used songs Category:2002 singles Category:2002 songs Category:Reprise Records singles Category:Post-hardcore songs Category:Songs written by Quinn Allman Category:Songs written by Jeph Howard Category:Songs written by Bert McCracken Category:Song recordings produced by John Feldmann Category:Songs written by Branden Steineckert
title: Buried Myself Alive
